intro: Derenbergia apiata, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asphodelaceae and is characterized by its tall, grass-like stems and narrow, sword-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or greenish flowers that bloom in spring. It is often found in coastal and wetland habitats, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Derenbergia apiata has been historically used by Māori for its strong fibers, which were woven into clothing and other practical items.
